subject: Pro X Pedals Issue
description_text:
*Dear Simsonn Support Team,*

I recently purchased a set of Pro X pedals second-hand, and I’ve managed to
get them working properly. However, the previous owner also included three
Simagic P-HPR (Haptic Pedal Reactors). These initially worked for a short
time but have since stopped functioning.

Here’s what I’ve done so far:

   - Updated the Control Box to the latest firmware.
   - Installed and am running the latest version of Simsonn Manager.
   - Verified that the 24V power supply is working and outputting the
   correct voltage.

Additional observations:

   - The Motor 1 port on the Control Box worked fairly consistently at
   first, while ports 2 and 3 did not.
   - At one point, all three ports worked briefly, but now none of them
   respond.
   - Swapping the P-HPR units between ports did not make any difference.

I suspect the issue may be related to the Control Box. Is there a specific
connection order (e.g., power first, then USB, or vice versa) that is
important for proper operation? Any troubleshooting steps you can provide
would be greatly appreciated.

To assist with identification, I’ve attached:

   - Photos of the retail box for the pedals.
   - A photo of the Control Box.
   - A screenshot of Simsonn Manager showing the firmware version of the
   Control Box and the software version of Simsonn Manager.

Thank you for your time and support. Please let me know if you need any
additional information.

Best regards,

Will Bann

conversations.body_text: Hi Will B,     Please uninstall any older versions of the software from your computer and install SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2. Then follow the steps below:    Open the software and go to Settings → Update, then click Check for Updates;    Check whether the ProX firmware can be updated to version 2.0.5;    If no automatic update is prompted, please select Manual Update: Path: Settings → Update → Manual Update Firmware → pedals → firmware → pedals-prox.sfu;    After the update is complete, please test the device again;    If the issue persists, try reconnecting the USB cable and power supply, then test again;    If the problem still remains, please send me a screenshot of the software interface, and I will help you investigate further.

Hi,

I followed the steps in your previous email, reinstalling the
Simsonn Manager software, manually updating the firmware and reconnecting
the USB and power cables and the haptic motors are still not working. I've
attached screenshots from the Simsonn Manager software as requested.

Regards,

Will

On Sat, 3 Jan 2026 at 19:49, service@simsonn.com

Hi Will B,  The ProX controller only supports one-direction control of voice coil motors, while the ProX Ultra supports bidirectional control. You may consider upgrading to the ProX Ultra controller, as it provides significantly stronger motor output compared to the ProX. If you are using Simagic motors, they are theoretically supported as well. At the moment, could you please confirm whether the vibration strength set to 10% is too low, and whether the issue still persists after unplugging and reconnecting the USB and power?      https://www.simsonn.com/products/simsonn-vam-pedals-haptic-reactor?variant=51399342293306

Hi,

I believe I have the newer control box (see attached). I am not getting any
vibration at any percentage. This had been working initially, but now isn't.
